item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Do you bite your thumb at us, sir?" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "All children mythologise their birth. It is a universal trait. You want to know someone? Heart, mind and soul? Ask him to tell you about when he was born. What you get wonâ€™t be the truth: it will be a story. And nothing is more telling than a story. " -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "One needs no particular talent to be polite. On the contrary, being nice is what's left when you've failed at everything else." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Like bear..." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "He wanted her to experience all the glorious cheese of life." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Keep in mind that many people have died for their beliefs; it's actually quite common. The real courage is in living and suffering for what you believe." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Of course you like him; everyone enjoys flattery." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "My head is throbbing. I need coffee. Leaving the marbled papers in a state of controlled chaos, I walk through the office and past the page's desk in the Reading Room. I am halted by Isabelle's voice saying, "Perhaps Mr. DeTamble can help you," by which she means "Henry, you weasel, where are you slinking off to?" and this astoundingly beautiful amber-haired tall slim girl turns around and looks at me as through I am her personal Jesus. My stomach lurches. Obviously she knows me, and I don't know her. Lord only knows what I've said, done, or promised to this luminous creature, so I am forced to say in my best librarianese, "Is there something I can help you with?" The girl sort of breathes "Henry!" in this very evocative way that convinces me that at some point in time we have a really amazing thing together. This makes it worse that I don't know anything about her, not even her name. I say "Have we met?" and Isabelle givs me a look that says You asshole. But the girl says, "I'm Claire Abshire. I knew you when I was a little girl," and invites me out to dinner. I accept, stunned." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Beethoven tells you what it's like to be Beethoven and Mozart tells you what it's like to be human. Bach tells you what it's like to be the universe." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "For Harry Potter I have all the time in the world." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Never try to outstubborn a cat." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "How you behave toward cats here below determines your status in Heaven." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Climate is what you expect, weather is what you get." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Work is not an end in itself; there must always be time enough for love." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There was a star danced, and under that was I born. " -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cheyenne add a quote by Ian Doescher
item.description:
"True it is,/ That these are not the droids for which thou search'st.
-Obi-Wan "Ben" Kenobi" -- Ian Doescher
